column4: resolution x1024 works fine in GNOME, but not in KDE! Is anyone familliar with this?
anyone?
UGHH!
have you changed the res in eithe rdesktop with the kde or gnome panel tools?
what exactly is Not working in KDE with it?
It is too big for my 17-inch monitor in KDE, but not in GNOME
define 'big'  - fonts too big? (ie res is LOW?) or res to high - its not showing?
you cannot see the whole screen
that would be too high-I geuss
you cannot see the whole screen
its in the perferances menus somewhere. you can pick from several themes, and the gdm has a config tool also.
hulu works very well here.
repartition the hd, then reformat it.
delete the partitions using a gparted live cd, then use whatver os you want to repartition/reformat as needed.
you may want to be sure you got windows bootloader reinstalled first.
most every iso/live cd out - can be put on a pendrive.
if theres no windows partitions. then theres no c:  or other letters.
#windows channel perhaps can help. I dont use XP any more.
you can delete the partions from a XP/windows cd/install also..
or use the fdisk command and the 'd' to delete.. to delete them all.. then 'w'rite changes to disk.
the xp installer may have some partioning tools. I dont use it.  so you got options mentioned above to try.
gparted is a special linux disrto for 'partitoning' and workign with hard drives.
you can use it to delete all partions if you want. and remake new ones how you like.
